content: This chunk defines a function `convert_doxygen_format` that processes lines of Doxygen-formatted documentation to convert them into a format compatible with Sphinx's reStructuredText syntax. The function handles replacements for HTML tags, backticks, and specific Doxygen commands (`@c`, `@p`) while resolving references using the fully qualified name of the module, class, or function being documented. def convert_doxygen_format(line, name, domain='py'): """Converts a single line of Doxygen formatting to Sphinx. The name argument is the fully qualified name of the current module, class or function, and is used to resolve references.""" line = line.replace('', '**').replace('', '**') # Single backticks in doxygen map to doubles in Sphinx line = line.replace('`', '``') # But double backticks are literal backticks line = line.replace('````', '\\`') # @c and @p result in double backticks for the subsequent word line = re.sub(at_c_at_p_pattern, r'``\1``', line) parent = name.rsplit('.', 1)[-1]
